page.title: 12S.P.A.C.E. Scheme Barton
page.content: S.P.A.C.E. stands for Staffordshire Police Activity and Community Enterprise.The scheme is designed to occupy children during the school holidays.The centre used in Barton is Thomas Russell Junior School and children in surrounding villages wishing to use the scheme,are collected and returned daily by mini buses.There are many activities catering for all tastes including swimming,trampolining, table tennis,pool,skateboarding,film shows,rollerskating and arcade games.If during the day you feel in need of refreshment there is a tuck shop where you may purchase drinks and simple snacks.Day outings are organised to places of interest like Alton Towers, Blackpool,RAF Cosford,Blue John Mines and Local museums. S.P.A.C.E. is open to all children between the ages of 8 and 16 and costs one pound to join.
